messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: oh, HELP!!!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/25/03 7:16:26 AM, dpiercy@adacomp.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/25/03 7:16:26 AM, dpiercy@... writes:

<< I am a lurker but just had to pop in and share my favorite way to keep a 3
y/o
occupied and happy while Mom is sick. Have her rub lotion on your legs, arms,
back and hands. A child that age usually loves the tactile aspect of it and
it
feels good for Mom, too. <g> You can even let her draw pictures with the
lotion on your back while you try to guess what she is drawing. It is best if
you have lotion in a pump type bottle and keep a towel handy. >>

What a great idea!!!

Holly and I have played a game where we draw a picture on the other's back
with a finger. Just something simple. The other person guesses what it is.
We should have added lotion!!

Next time. Thanks!

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: oh, HELP!!!
messages.msgSnippet: I am a lurker but just had to pop in and share my favorite way to keep a 3 y/o occupied and happy while Mom is sick.  Have her rub lotion on your legs, arms,
messages.messageBody:
I am a lurker but just had to pop in and share my favorite way to keep a 3 y/o
occupied and happy while Mom is sick. Have her rub lotion on your legs, arms,
back and hands. A child that age usually loves the tactile aspect of it and it
feels good for Mom, too. <g> You can even let her draw pictures with the
lotion on your back while you try to guess what she is drawing. It is best if
you have lotion in a pump type bottle and keep a towel handy.

Deanna
David's wife, mom to Chris (19) and Lisa (15)
Zookeeper at Apple Tree Farm
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You can never get a cup of tea large enough
or a book long enough to suit me.
~C.S. Lewis~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
